title: Minneapolis police insisted on 'no knock' warrant that led to Amir Locke's shooting death; city announces moratorium - Minneapolis Star Tribune
content:
1. Minneapolis police insisted on 'no knock' warrant that led to Amir Locke's shooting death; city announces moratorium  Minneapolis Star Tribune
  2. Minneapolis police release body camera footage of fatal shooting of Black man, 22, during no-knock warrant  Yahoo News
  3. Minneapolis cop fatally shoots Black man while raiding flat  New York Daily News
  4. Car Caravan Briefly Blocks Traffic In Downtown Minneapolis In Protest Of Amir Locke Killing  CBS Minnesota
  5. Body camera video shows Minneapolis officers shooting Black man during no-knock warrant. Attorneys say he wasn't the target  CNN
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
description: Officers were at the downtown Minneapolis apartment unit to serve a search warrant in connection with a St. Paul homicide investigation. Locke was not the subject of the warrant.
